hint.text: Opposite sides of a parallelogram are equal.

solution.text:
we know that diagonal of parallelogram divides it in two triangles of equal areas
Therefore, area of parallelogram = 2\(\times \)area of triangle
Area of triangle by heron's formula :
Area = \(\sqrt {s(s-a)(s-b)(s-c)}\)
Here, a = _{{3*j}}_, b = _{{4*j}}_ , c = _{{5*j}}_ and s = _{{6*j}}_
Therefore applying heron's formula as :
Area = \(\sqrt {_{{6*j}}_(_{{6*j}}_-_{{3*j}}_)(_{{6*j}}_-_{{4*j}}_)(_{{6*j}}_-_{{5*j}}_)}\)
Area = \(\sqrt {_{{6*j}}_(_{{3*j}}_)(_{{2*j}}_)(_{{1*j}}_)}\)
Area = _{{6*j*j}}_
Hence, Area of the parallelogram = 2\(\times\)_{{6*j*j}}_
i.e., Area of the parallelogram = _{{12*j*j}}_

content.text: Suppose the two adjacent sides of a parallelogram _{{3*j}}_ cm and _{{4*j}}_ cm and the diagonal measures _{{5*j}}_ cm, what is the area of the parallelogram?
